summary: Completed frontend testing of 2 new features: Technical Indicators (MA/RSI/MACD) and PDF Export. All features working correctly with proper UI components, data display, and user interactions.

issues: Console warnings about chart width/height being -1 when RSI/MACD charts are first rendered - cosmetic issue, charts render correctly after brief delay

passed_tests: Technical Indicators chart type selector shows in chart type buttons (first icon - TrendingUp)
Clicking Technical Indicators icon shows settings panel with 'Technical Indicators' header
Moving Averages checkbox toggle works (checked by default)
RSI checkbox toggle works and shows RSI chart below main chart
MACD checkbox toggle works and shows MACD chart below RSI
MA Short period input is configurable (default: 20, range: 5-100)
MA Long period input is configurable (default: 50, range: 10-200)
RSI period input is configurable (default: 14, range: 5-50)
MACD fast input is configurable (default: 12, range: 5-30)
MACD slow input is configurable (default: 26, range: 10-50)
MACD signal input is configurable (default: 9, range: 3-20)
Latest MA Short value displays correctly (e.g., $6,874.73)
Latest MA Long value displays correctly (e.g., $6,911.68)
RSI value displays with status (e.g., 58.7 (neutral))
RSI shows overbought/oversold/neutral status correctly
MACD values display (MACD line and Signal line)
MACD shows bullish/bearish status correctly
RSI chart shows reference lines at 30 (oversold) and 70 (overbought)
MACD chart shows histogram bars and MACD/Signal lines
Export PDF button appears in Analytics modal header (red button)
Export PDF button is visible and enabled
Export PDF button triggers PDF download successfully
PDF filename format is correct: performance_report_{period}_{date}.pdf
seed_data_creation: None - used existing portfolio positions for analytics data
context_for_next_testing_agent: Two new features tested: 1) Technical Indicators - accessible via first chart type button (TrendingUp icon), shows MA/RSI/MACD with configurable periods and real-time values. RSI shows overbought/oversold/neutral status, MACD shows bullish/bearish status. 2) PDF Export - red button in Analytics modal header, generates comprehensive performance report PDF with trade history. Both features fully functional.
